intro: Euphrasia collina subsp. deflexifolia, commonly known as the bent-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and often exhibit a distinctive downward curvature, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
